name: suspected
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
believed to be true or to exist: He has a suspected broken leg.
believed to be guilty of a crime: suspected terrorists See
suspect
More examplesFewer examplesThey've cordoned off the whole area because of a suspected bomb.The police have kept the nightclub under surveillance because of suspected illegal drug activity.He has to watch what he eats because of a suspected stomach ulcer.Her suspected interest in the takeover has been the subject of a lot of press reporting.He died of a suspected heart attack at age 87.

Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe someone that people believe may have committed a particular crime, or a crime that people believe may have been committed: Police arrested three suspected terrorists. a suspected spy/fraudster/thief a suspected crime/fraud/conspiracy
